content.description: <math alttext="2 P C l 3 gas plus O 2 gas react to produce 2 P O C l 3 gas" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><msub><mrow><mtext>PCl</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>(</mtext><mi>g</mi><mtext>)</mtext><mo>+</mo><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>(</mtext><mi>g</mi><mtext>)</mtext><mo>→</mo><mn>2</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><msub><mrow><mtext>POCl</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>(</mtext><mi>g</mi><mtext>)</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>
content.question: Substance Approximate <math alttext="S naught in joules per mole kelvin" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>S</mi><mi>°</mi><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>(</mtext><mtext>J/(mol</mtext><mo>⋅</mo><mtext>K)</mtext><mtext>)</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="P C l 3 gas" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>PCl</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>(</mtext><mi>g</mi><mtext>)</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> 310 <math alttext="O 2 gas" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>(</mtext><mi>g</mi><mtext>)</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> 210 <math alttext="P O C l 3 gas" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>POCl</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>(</mtext><mi>g</mi><mtext>)</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> 330 The oxidation of <math alttext=" P C l 3 gas" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>PCl</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>(</mtext><mi>g</mi><mtext>)</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> is represented by the equation above, and the table provides the approximate values of the absolute molar entropies, <math alttext="S naught" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>S</mi><mi>°</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>, for these substances. Based on the information given, what is the approximate <math alttext="delta S naught" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>S</mi><mi>°</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> for the reaction?

choices.label: <math alttext="Positive 170 joules per mole of reaction kelvin" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo>+</mo><mn>170</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><msub><mrow><mtext>J/(mol</mtext></mrow><mrow><mi>r</mi><mi>x</mi><mi>n</mi></mrow></msub><mo>⋅</mo><mtext>K)</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="negative 170 joules per mole of reaction kelvin" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>170</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><msub><mrow><mtext>J/(mol</mtext></mrow><mrow><mi>r</mi><mi>x</mi><mi>n</mi></mrow></msub><mo>⋅</mo><mtext>K)</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="Positive 190 joules per mole of reaction kelvin" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo>+</mo><mn>190</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><msub><mrow><mtext>J/(mol</mtext></mrow><mrow><mi>r</mi><mi>x</mi><mi>n</mi></mrow></msub><mo>⋅</mo><mtext>K)</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="negative 190 joules per mole of reaction kelvin" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>190</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><msub><mrow><mtext>J/(mol</mtext></mrow><mrow><mi>r</mi><mi>x</mi><mi>n</mi></mrow></msub><mo>⋅</mo><mtext>K)</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>

skill.text: 5.F: Calculate, estimate, or predict an unknown quantity from known quantities by selecting and following a logical computational pathway and attending to precision (e.g., performing dimensional analysis and attending to significant figures).
